Article Sharing

Language alone protects us from the scariness of things with no names

—— Toni Morrison, The Nobel Lecture In Literature, 1983

The average 20 year old knows between 27,000 and 52,000 different words. By age 60, that number averages between 35,000 and 56,000. Spoken out loud, most of these words last less than a second. So with every word, the brain has a quick decision to make: which of those thousands of options matches the signal? About 98% of the time, the brain chooses the correct word. But how? Speech comprehension is different from reading comprehension, but it is similar to sign language comprehension —— though spoken word recognition has been studied more than sign language. The key to our ability to understand speech is the brain`s role as a parallel processor, meaning that it can do multiple different things at the same time.

Most theories assume that each word we know is represented by a separate processing unit that has just one job: to assess the likelihood of incoming speech matching that particular word. In the context of the brain the processing unit that represents a word is likely a pattern of firing activity across a group of neurons in brain`s cortex. When we hear the beginning of the word, several thousand such units may become active, because with just the beginning of a word, there are many possible matches. Then, as the word goes on, more and more units register that some vital piece of information is missing and lost activity. Possibly well before the end of the word, just one firing pattern remains active, corresponding to one word. This is called the ‘Recognition Point’. In the process of honing in on one word, the active units suppress the activity of others, saving vital milliseconds. Most people comprehend up to about 8 syllables per second. Yet the goal is not only to recognize the word, but also to access its stored meaning. The brain accesses many possible meanings at the same time, before the word has been fully identified. We know this from studies which show that even upon hearing a word fragment —— like “Cap” —— listeners will start to register multiple possible meanings, like caption or capital before the full word emerges. This suggest that every time we heard a word there`s a brief explosion of meanings in our minds, and by the recognition point the brain has settled on one interpretation. The recognition process moves more rapidly with a sentence that gives us context that a random string of words. Context also helps guide us towards the intended meaning of words with multiple interpretations, like “bat” or “crane” or in cases of homophones like “no” or “know”. For multilingual people, the language they are listening to is another cue, used to eliminate potential words that don`t match the language context.

So, what about adding completely new words to this system? Even as adults, we may come across a new word every few days. But if every world is represented as a fine-tuned pattern of activity distributed over many neurons, how do we prevent new words from overwriting old ones? We think that to avoid this problem, new words are initially stored in a part of the brain called the hippocampus, well away from the main store of words in the cortex, so they don`t share neurons with others words. Then, over multiple nights of sleep, the new words gradually transfer over and interweave with old ones. Researchers think this gradual acquisition process help avoid disruption existing words. So in the daytime, unconscious activity generates explosions of meaning as we chat away. At night, we rest, but our brains are busy integrating new knowledge into the word network. When we wake up, this process ensures that we`re ready for the ever-changing world of language.

Article Sharing

Remembering Hollywood Actress Elizabeth Taylor

Elizabeth Taylor was born in 1932 to American parents living in London. Her father Francis was an art dealer. Her mother Sara had worked as a stage actress before her marriage. The Taylors left England in 1939 and moved to southern California. Elizabeth`s beauty soon caught the attention of movie studio officials.
She made over sixty films during her long career in Hollywood. She was famous for her striking beauty violet eyes and shining black hair. Taylor was equally known for her complex private life and eight marriages. Beginning in the 1980s, she also raised millions of dollars to support AIDS research.
Elizabeth Taylor died of heart failure in 2011 at the age of 79. AIDS researcher Mathilde told USA today that the actress was always known for her beauty, success and jewelry. But she said Elizabeth Taylor was also a woman of extreme intelligence, independence, courage and a deep concern for others.

entry.title: English Study 03
entry.content:
Today we will learn about forty words and an introduction the history of keltoi.

Backround

Alexander: 马其顿的亚历山大三世，世称亚历山大大帝，古希腊马其顿王国国王，是古希腊著名王室阿吉德王朝成员。亚历山大出生于前356年的佩拉，在二十岁时从他的父王腓力二世手上继承马其顿王位，几乎他的统治期间都在进行前无古人的大型军事征服活动。

Julius Caesar: 盖乌斯·尤利乌斯·恺撒，或译儒略·恺撒，罗马共和国末期的军事统帅、政治家，是罗马共和国体制转向罗马帝国的关键人物，史称恺撒大帝或罗马共和国的独裁者。他也是拉丁文散文的作者。 恺撒出身贵族，历任财务官、大祭司、大法官、执政官、监察官、独裁官等职。

Vercingetorix: 维钦托利，又译韦辛格托里克斯，是高卢阿维尔尼人的部落首领，曾领导高卢人对罗马统治的最后反抗。 维钦托利是阿维尔尼首领之子，在高卢战争末期，他领导高卢人民试图将入侵的凯撒及其军队赶出高卢。在前52年的阿莱西亚之战中败北，随后被押送罗马关押，并在前46年凯撒庆祝胜利仪式期间处决。

Boudicca: 布狄卡，旧名博阿迪西亚，威尔士语中称她为比达格，是英格兰东英吉利亚地区古代爱西尼部落的王后和女王，其丈夫普拉苏塔古斯是爱西尼人的统治者。由于在丈夫普拉苏塔古斯去世后，罗马人抢去了其土地、自己受毒打，深爱的女儿们惨遭凌辱、国民要交重税，因此她领导了不列颠诸部落反抗罗马帝国占领军统治的起义。

Article Sharing

No Less terrifying ware […] the naked warriors in front, all oh whom wre finely built men in thei prime of life.

—— Polybius, “The Histories”

One summer evening in 335 BCE, Alexander the Great was resting by the Danube River after a day of fighting the Scythian tribes when a band of strangers approached his camp. Alexander had never anything like these tall, fierce-looking warriors with huge golden neck rings and colorful cloaks, so he invited them to feast with him.

They proudly said they were Keltoi or Celts who came from the far-away Alps. Alexander asked what they feared the most in the world, hoping they would say him. They laughed and said they feared nothing at all. This is one of the earliest stories about the ancient Celts.

While we don`t know where the first Celts came from, by Alexander`s time they spread across Europe from Asia Minor in the east to Spain and the Atlantic islands of Britain and Ireland in the west. The Celts were never one unified empire, and they didn`t build cities or monuments. Instead, they were hundreds of independent tribes who spoke the same language. Each had its own warrior-king and religious center.

The tribes fought each other as enthusiastically as the fought their enemies. Few armies could stand up to them. Somewhat unusually for their time, the Celts believed in reincarnation that they would be reborn on Earth to live and feast and fight again, which may have contributed to their fearlessness in battle. Some of them fought naked, scoffing at their enemies` armor.

The greatest trophy a Celtic warrior could possess was the severed head of a foe. They preserve these heads in jars of cedar oil and showed them to guests who visited their homes. Celtic warriors were so value in the ancient world, the foreign kings often hired them as mercenary soldiers to serve in their armies.

But the Celts were much more than just warriors. Among them were many skilled craftsmen, artists, and great poets called bards. The bards sang of the brave deeds of their ancestors and praised the accomplishments of warrior kings, and composed biting satires about cowardly or selfish leaders.

The Celts worshipped many gods, and priests known as druids oversaw this worship. Anyone could become a druid, but the training required many years of study and memorization, the druids were not allowed to record any of their teachings in writing. Druids supervised religious practices and sacrifices to the gods, but they also teachers, healers, judges, and scientists. They were so respected that they could step between warring tribes in the middle of a battle and call an end to the fighting. No Celt would dare to harm a druid, or question their decisions.

In the 2nd century BCE, the Romans began to encroach on Celtic territory, conquering the tribes of northern Italy. Rather than unite against the Roman legions in response to this defeat, the Celts maintained their tribal divisions. The tribes of Spain fell soon after. In the 1st century BCE, Julius Caesar marched his armies across France, using bribery, threats, and lies to turn tribes against each other. Only in the closing days of this great was did the Celts unite against their common enemy under the leadership of king Vercingetorix, but it was too late. Countless warriors and their families die or were enslaved as the Romans conquered France.

Protected by the surrounding waters, the Celtic tribes of Britain and Ireland were the last holdouts. When the Romans finally invaded Britain, the queen Boudicca united her tribe in a revolt after her husband was killed. She almost succeeded in driving the Roman legions out of Britain before dying as she led a final battle against the enemy.

By the end of the 1st century CE, Ireland alone, far out at sea, remain unconquered by Rome. There, the ways of the ancient Celts survived untouched by the outside world long after Rome itself lay in ruins.

entry.title: Beginning On Clouds
entry.content:
先下面聊聊为什么用这个名字吧，“风从云上走过”。意思是说当你想要以一种轻松的生活，你就要用一种厚重的方式来承载它，生活就是这样，等价交换。人总会以一种你看不见的方式去努力。所以就写下来这个名字。

其实细想下来想记录下自己的生活已经好久了，不过忙忙碌碌的状态一直没有停下来过，考虑了太多自己到底要写什么，反而就这样搁置起来。感觉工作以后，越来越需要通过写下来的方式来记录。特别是从事IT以后，我的生活就越来越被各种信息打扰。所以我关了朋友圈，不看微博，减少了信息被推送。

后面会慢慢更新这个订阅号的，同时后面还会在Blog上同步。也跟大家分享下目前关于这块架构的想法(毕竟做IT，猫头)，手机端会用微信订阅号和小程序，PC端目前的想法是用GitLab Page和Hexo来生成。

目前就这些啦，期待后面开始新的生活。

entry.title: 敬畏时间，失去的永远不会回来
entry.content:
敬畏时间，失去的永远不会回来

———— 墨菲定律：如果有两种或两种以上的方式去做某件事情，而其中一种选择方式将导致灾难，则必定有人会做出这种选择。根本内容是：如果事情有变坏的可能，不管这种可能性有多小，它总会发生。

今天在电影院又把心心念念的时候星际穿越看了一遍，这是第三次看了，发现了一些之前没有注意的细节。虽然中间有点插曲，但评论总归是要写的。

先来交代下背景，因为整部剧把背景框架穿插在几个小对话里，然后通过布兰德教授和库珀父亲的话讲述出来的。故事是发生在二十世纪后某个时间，地球已经黄沙密布，农作物相继因为枯萎病已经灭绝。人类把目光从头顶放在了脚下，对宇宙的探索和畅想也已经从书本中移除，基础科学变得微不足道。前宇航员库珀在一个机缘巧合下参与到一个探索其他宜居星球的计划中，人类的命运延续在此一举，主人公们踏上了探索和自我救赎的道路。

电影的全篇虽然是以一种宇宙探索的角度拍摄的，但剥去科幻的壳，留下来的只有感情和爱了。库珀对女儿墨菲的感情，艾米莉亚对父亲布兰德教授的感情。每个人都在最后完成的自我救赎，库珀对女儿的愧疚与思念，墨菲对父亲的爱与接受，布兰德教授在临死前面对自己谎言的坦诚，甚至是曼恩博士，从最初的先驱者，到经历过惨痛失败后的灰心意冷，虽然他代表着人性弱的一边，但是死亡对于他来说也是解脱。我觉得整部电影有两个点一直在贯穿。一个是墨菲定律，感觉编剧一直在把故事推向一个又一个的绝望，你以为整个计划是为了拯救人类，其实从以开始就注定了失败。另一个就是汉斯·季默的配乐，每一段音乐都可以单独拿出来聆听，宏大，而又震撼心灵。这可能就是我喜欢这部电影的原因，虽然时常逼近三个小时，但是很多场景都指的回味，首位剧情的呼应，很多小细节细细看下来，才大呼“原来如此”。

喜欢的场景 | 咆哮吧，咆哮，痛斥那光的退缩

第一次出现在探索小队出发进入太空的时候，由演员迈克尔·凯恩口述，诗中的“know dark is right”也预示着这趟旅途并非顺利。众人乘坐着空间站想着远方驶去，背景是一片虚无，未来依旧是未知不可捉摸的。第二次出现在曼恩博士和库珀搏斗的时候，他一直在念着这首诗，好像是在为自己的选择找个理由。

Do not go gentle into that good night,
不要温顺地走进那个良夜
Old age should burn and rave at close of day;
激情不能被消沉的暮色淹没
Rage, rage against the dying of the light.
咆哮吧，咆哮，痛斥那光的退缩

Though wise men at their end know dark is right,
智者在临终的时候对黑暗妥协
Because their words had forked no lightning they
是因为他们的语言已黯然失色
Do not go gentle into that good night.
他们也不想被夜色迷惑
Rage, rage against the dying of the light.
咆哮吧，咆哮，痛斥那光的退缩

《不要温顺地走进那个良夜》是英国诗人狄兰·托马斯创作于20世纪中期的诗歌，该诗歌表达了诗人对于死神将可爱的人们带离这个世界的愤怒，即“怒斥光明的消逝”。

喜欢的场景 | 是我，墨菲，我就是你的幽灵

这句话出现在影片的结尾，124岁的库珀在墨菲的病床前见面的时候，库珀说“我是你的幽灵”，其实电影的前40分钟也在体现这一点。然后墨菲说的话其实最令人感动，墨菲对库珀说“父母不该看着自己的孩子死去。我的孩子都在这里，你走吧 …. 去找布兰德，她还在那边，独自一人，在陌生的星系，准备继续休眠了。“人类不应该孤独的活着，当有人想思念，才会有记忆。

Brand
布兰德
She’s out there.
她还在太空里
Setting up camp.
在搭建营地
Alone…
独自一人
In a strange galaxy.
在一个陌生的星系
Maybe right now she’s settling in for a long nap…
也许她现在正准备去睡一个长觉
By the light of our new sun.
沐浴着新太阳的光芒
In our new home.
在我们新的家园

entry.title: MySql安装与配置
entry.content:
在Ubuntu上安装MySQL

第一步：

执行如下脚本安装软件：

sudo apt-get install mysql-server //服务端
sudo apt-get install mysql-client //客户端
sudo apt-get install libmysqlclient-dev //程序编译时链接的库

安装成功后，查看MySQL服务是否启动：

sudo netstat -tap | grep mysql

sudo service mysql status

第二步：

修改如下文件，查看登陆账号和密码

$sudo vim /etc/mysql/debian.cnf

mysql -u debian-sys-maint -pwOggPc3LQvw9Bz1Y

select host from user where user=’debian-sys-maint’;

update user set host = ‘%’ where user =’debian-sys-maint’;

第三步：

登陆MySQL，并设置Root账号

mysql> update mysql.user set authentication_string=password(‘new password’) where user=’root’ and >Host =’localhost’;
mysql> update user set plugin=”mysql_native_password”;
mysql> flush privileges;
mysql> quit;

第四步：

重启mysql服务sudo service mysql restart，之后就可以以root用户登陆了，密码就是你刚才设置的”new password”。

#服务管理
#启动
sudo service mysql start
#停止
sudo service mysql stop
